channel.title: Familiar?
channel.description:
I had a thought earlier today about programming your own planet. Obviously we can program with 'binary code' or set of instructions for a processor to handle. The idea is to take control of matter/energy and 'program' it the way we want. We do this currently but to a very limited extent.
In order to ensure our survival we need to become a multi plant species. Or we are done for, there is no way we can sit on this rock forever. The closest place that may seem somewhat legit is thousands of light years away so what if we just made our own planets? Programmed them...
I believe I had this thought when a few friends and I were talking about the speed of light, asteroids, diamonds (for computers and shit)
Maybe I am just high. Has anyone explored this thought?

item.title: Familiar?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

dat thread derailment…

@OP: Are you talking about a practical implementation of your theory? I can only think of a virtual machine, but ok.
The theory on its own is… a bit weird, to say the least. What’s the use in ‘changing’ the laws of physics if you aren’t appending the changes to the actual universe but rather one which you’d have to recreate first? You see the same stuff happening every day… video games o.o

Read full topic

item.title: Familiar?
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:21, topic:523040”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=641535.msg4322441#msg4322441 date=1372383383]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=641535.msg4322431#msg4322431 date=1372382460]

We could create atoms but that’s the lowest level we can go to
[/quote]Uh… you can’t “create” atoms
[/quote]Yeah I know we can’t which is why I said “could” instead of “can”… a few hundred years ago people thought the earth was flat (well, they never thought it was flat, they thought it was dome-shaped, but that’s neither here nor there…)

if by a few hundred years you mean a few millennium ago, then sure, the greeks figured out that the earth was round a few centuries bc[/quote]

Eratosthenes calculated the circumference of the Earth a few hundred years BC, that’s more then knowing it was round that’s making an approximation as to how round it was. The idea that an educated man who lived during the time of Columubus would not know that the Earth is round is a common misconception of the middle ages, and quite frankly absurd.

Read full topic

item.title: Familiar?
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

I finally came across something on the internet (a book) that goes into detail on what my idea is.

“everything in the universe is made of bits. Not chunks of stuff, but chunks of information — ones and zeros. … Atoms and electrons are bits. Atomic collisions are “ops.” Machine language is the laws of physics. The universe is a quantum computer”

en.wikipedia.org

Programming the Universe

Programming the Universe: A Quantum Computer Scientist Takes On the Cosmos is a 2006 popular science book by Seth Lloyd, professor of mechanical engineering at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. The book proposes that the universe is a quantum computer, and advances in the understanding of physics may come from viewing entropy as a phenomenon of information, rather than simply thermodynamics. Lloyd also postulates that the universe can be fully simulated using a quantum computer; however,...

Read full topic

item.title: Familiar?
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:4, topic:523040”]In real term you can’t program a planet. If you want to sustain life outside of earth you would need the necessary for life such as water, warmth and a sustainable environment.

I’m not sure if your saying computers could be used for life support for a planet or are you talking totally alternate to what is currently “life”? To live in a computer?

Maybe I should post again when I’m high because I’m have a hard time working out wtf you’re talking about.

[/quote]

Read full topic
